preface the highland municipal highland utah was initially published by the municipal municode the maintained and updated  in 201 codification and administration of the municipal inhouse under the direction of the city recorder and with the assistance of municipal inc this municipal be cited as the highland municipal hmc as an acronym this municipal a structure by subject matter using a decimal numbering system identifying the title chapter and section for example  the first number in the sequence  designates the title level the second series of numbers  designates the the last series  designates the if a fourth series exists comprising letters or numbers beyond a section level it designates a this complete set of numbers is designed to aid in searching the municipal to assist in subsequent codification as new ordinances are added to the municipal outline give structure and more granularly reference the legislation herein the following list order or pattern of ascending alphanumeric characters is used a 1 a 1 a a drafting future legislation with this list order reconciles it with the online codes list order to forego the naming of each list item and to more granularly reference legislation that employs alphanumeric characters use always capitalized followed by the desired alphanumeric references comma separated for example d specifically references item d of item 7 of item bwhereas refers more generally to any or all of s descendants the legislation may also be arranged as an unordered list using bullets discs squares etc to show items without hierarchical relationships this numbering system and list structure assists in subsequent codification as new legislation is added vacant titles chapters or sections may be designed for future use and may be marked reserved to ease internal expansion the legislative history identifies the specific legal sources of a section as may be provided in footnotes the municipal supplemented from timetotime with amendments and additions made by highland city the specific legal sources that comprise this municipal been adapted during the codification process from the original formatting of the official hard copy in the event of discrepancies between the online municipal the official hard copy the official hard copy governs municipal inc provides a searchable database of the municipal easy reference and convenience notice the municipal code may not reflect all or the most current version of legislation adopted by the city council that has yet to be updated online in the event of conflict between the municipal code and a written ordinance the ordinance typically governs also the municipal code may not reflect rules or other regulations promulgated under the authority of the code including technical specifications for more information contact the city office at 8017565751 title 1 general provisions code adoption general provisions annexation procedure general penalty code adoption citation  reference pursuant to authority of of utah as amended a revision and codification of the general ordinances of highland city has been prepared under authority of the city council the revised and codified ordinances have been compiled edited and published by book publishing company in one volume entitled as highland municipal copies of that document are on file in the office of the city recorder for public inspection the city recorder shall continue to maintain three copies of the highland municipal his or her office for public use and inspections highland municipal as compiled edited and published by book publishing company is adopted as the general ordinances of highland city it shall be sufficient to refer to the code as the highland municipal  in any prosecution for the violation of any provision thereof or in any proceeding at law or in equity it shall be sufficient to designate any ordinance adding to amending correcting or repealing all or any part or portion thereof as an addition to amendment to correction or repeal of the highland municipal  further reference may be had to the titles chapters sections and subsections of the highland municipal  and such references shall apply to that numbered title chapter section or subsection as it appears in the code hmc   reference applies to amendments whenever a reference is made to this code as the highland municipal  or to any portion thereof or to any ordinance of highland city codified herein the reference shall apply to all amendments corrections and additions heretofore now or hereafter made hmc   title title chapter and section headings contained herein shall not be deemed to govern limit modify or in any manner affect the scope meaning or intent of the provisions of any title chapter or section hereof hmc   reference to specific provisions of this code shall not in any manner affect matters of record which refer to or are otherwise connected with ordinances which are therein specifically designated by number or otherwise and which are included within the code but such reference shall be construed to apply to the corresponding provisions contained within this code hmc   ordinances passed prior to the last ordinance included in the highland municipal adopted by is which was adopted by the city council on  the following ordinances which were adopted by the city council subsequent to but prior to the adoption of the highland municipal are adopted and made a part of the code 199318  19941  19944  19947 the city recorder is directed to codify those ordinances and include the provisions thereof in subsequent supplements to or editions of highland municipal   effect of passed actions and obligations the adoption of this code does not affect prosecutions for ordinance violations committed prior to the effective date of this code does not waive any fee or penalty due and unpaid on the effective date of this code and does not affect the validity of any bond or cash deposit posted filed or deposited pursuant to the provisions of this code hmc   constitutionality if any section subsection sentence clause or phrase of this code is for any reason held to be invalid or unconstitutional such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this code hmc   references generally references in city forms documents and regulations to ordinances which are compiled in this code shall be construed to apply to the corresponding provisions contained within this code hmc  general provisions  definitions  titles of officers and boards understood to be of highland  construance of language  grammatical interpretation  construance of ordinances to include authorized agents  unlawful acts  computation of time periods  ordinances to promote justice  repeal shall not revive any ordinances  definitions the following words and phrases whenever used in the ordinances of the city of highland utah shall be construed as defined in this section unless from the context a different meaning is intended or unless a different meaning is specifically defined and more particularly directed to the use of such words or phrases city and town mean the city of highland utah or the area within the territorial limits of the city of highland utah and such territory outside the territorial limits over which the city has jurisdiction or control by virtue of any constitutional or statutory provision council means the city council of the city of highland utah all of its members or all council members means the total number of council members holding office county means utah county law denotes applicable federal law the constitution and statutes of the state of utah the ordinances of the city of highland utah and when appropriate any and all rules and regulations promulgated thereafter may is permissive month means a calendar month must and shall are each mandatory oath means and includes an affirmation or declaration in all cases in which by law an affirmation may be substituted for an oath and in such cases the words swear and sworn shall be equivalent to the words affirm and affirmed owner applied to a building or land includes any part owner joint owner tenant in common joint tenant tenant by the entirety or the whole or a part of such building or land person means and includes a natural person joint venture joint stock company limited liability company partnership association club company corporation business trust organization or the manager lessee agent servant officer or employee of any of them personal property means and includes money goods chattels things in action and evidences of debt preceding and following mean next before and next after respectively property means and includes real and personal property real property means and includes lands tenements and hereditaments sidewalks means that portion of a street between the curbline and the adjacent property line intended for the use of pedestrians state means the state of utah street means and includes all streets highways avenues lanes alleys courts places squares curbs or other public ways in the city which have been or may hereafter be dedicated and open to public use or such other public property so designated in any law of the state tenant and occupant applied to a building or land include any person who occupies the whole or any part of such building or land whether alone or with others written means and includes printed typewritten mimeographed multigraphed or otherwise reproduced in permanent visible form year means a calendar year hmc 1  titles of officers and boards understood to be of highland use in any ordinance or resolution of the title of any officer employee department board or commission means that officer employee department board or commission of the city of highland utah hmc 2  construance of language all words and phrases in any ordinance or resolution shall be construed according to the common and approved usage of language but technical words and phrases and such others as may have acquired a peculiar and appropriate meaning in the law shall be construed and understood according to such peculiar and appropriate meaning hmc 3  grammatical interpretation the following grammatical rules shall apply in the ordinances and resolutions of the city of highland utah unless it is apparent that a different construction is intended each gender includes the masculine feminine and neuter genders the singular number includes the plural and the plural includes the singular words used in the present tense include the past and future tenses and vice versa unless manifestly inapplicable hmc 4  construance of ordinances to include authorized agents when an act is required by an ordinance the same being such that it may be done as well by an agent as the principal such requirement shall be construed to include all such acts performed by an authorized agent hmc 5  unlawful acts whenever in the ordinances of the city of highland utah any act or omission is made unlawful it shall include causing allowing permitting aiding abetting suffering or concealing the fact of such act or omission hmc 6  computation of time periods except when otherwise specifically provided the time within which an act is required to be done shall be computed by excluding the first day and including the last day unless the last day is sunday or a holiday in which case it shall also be excluded hmc 7  ordinances to promote justice the provisions of the ordinances of the city of highland utah and all proceeding under them are to be construed with a view to effect their objects and to promote justice hmc 8  repeal shall not revive any ordinances the repeal of an ordinance shall not repeal the repealing clause of an ordinance or revive any ordinance which has been repealed thereby hmc 9 annexation procedure  in general  proposal for annexation  petition  impact statement  policy declaration  fee  in general the procedures in this chapter are established and the fees in this chapter are set relative to the annexation process and the preparation of the required policy declaration for annexations exceeding five acres hmc part  proposal for annexation a proposal for annexation of a specific parcel of land shall be presented to the city council for the purpose of determining whether or not the city council is willing to accept a petition for such annexation acceptance shall be indicated by a motion of record and a majority vote of the city council said action does not constitute annexation but simply indicates the city councils willingness to accept a petition for annexation into the regular annexation channels hmc   petition upon receiving notice by the city council of a willingness to accept such petition the petitioners shall then submit a petition requesting annexation signed by a majority of the owners of property in the area said owners must represent at least onethird of the assessed valuation according to the last assessment rolls the petition must be accompanied by a plat of the area drawn by an engineer or surveyor the petition must be accepted by a twothirds vote of the city council for the purpose of preparing a policy declaration relative to the proposed annexation hmc   impact statement said petition and plat must also be accompanied by an impact statement prepared by the petitioner or his representative consisting of the following land use presently existing and those proposed by the petitioning parties  current and potential population of the area and the current residential densities  statement as to how the proposed area andor its proposed land use would contribute to the achievement of the goals and policies of the highland city master plan  an estimate of the tax consequences to residents of the area to be annexed as well as to the city and county  whereas by city ordinance it is unlawful to remove water shares from highland city boundaries a list of all irrigation water used and its ownership shall be provided for all property in the territory to be annexed  statement from all utility companies indicating a willingness and ability to serve area including construction of services  statement approved by the highland city engineer outlining sewer collective system plans hmc   policy declaration upon presentation of the petition plat and impact statement to the planning and zoning commission the city will prepare the necessary policy declaration which will outline the potential demand for various municipal services and the need for land use regulation in the area the following specifics shall be included distance from existing utility lines  special zoning needed  distances to public schools parks and shopping centers for traffic generated by such land uses  timetable for extending services to the area and how these services would be financed hmc   fee a fee of one hundred twenty dollars plus two dollars per acre or part thereof will be charged to the petitioners for the preparation of the policy declaration such fee along with all other fees incident to the annexation process shall be paid prior to scheduling said petition and policy statement for review by the highland city planning and zoning commission hmc  general penalty  violation  class b misdemeanor when  violation  each day a separate offense  violation  penalty  violation  class b misdemeanor when any person violating any of the provisions or failing to comply with any of the mandatory requirements of any ordinance of the city of highland utah is guilty of a misdemeanor or an infraction as the particular ordinance may specify if the ordinance does not specify whether the violation or failure is a misdemeanor or an infraction or if the ordinance does not specify which class of misdemeanor is applicable the person shall be guilty of a class b misdemeanor hmc  1  violation  each day a separate offense a person is guilty of a separate offense for each and every day during any portion of which any violation of any provision of the ordinances of the city is committed continued or permitted by any such person and he is punishable accordingly hmc  2  violation  penalty a person who has been convicted of a misdemeanor may be sentenced to imprisonment as follows in the case of a class a misdemeanor for a term not exceeding one year  in the case of a class b misdemeanor for a term not exceeding six months  in the case of a class c misdemeanor for a term not exceeding ninety days a person convicted of an offense may be sentenced to pay a fine not exceeding two thousand five hundred dollars when the conviction is of a class a misdemeanor  one thousand dollars when the conviction is of a class b misdemeanor  seven hundred fifty dollars when the conviction is of a class c misdemeanor or infraction hmc  3 title 2 administration and personnel city officers generally mayor and city council city administrator city recorder city treasurer justice court city records community trees constitutional taking  review procedures disposal of public property city officers generally  voter registration required  residence in city required when  employment of relatives prohibited when  appointment of city treasurer and city recorder  powers and duties  how defined  oath of office  execution of bonds  standards of conduct  conflict of interest  terms of office  remove from office  expiration of term  delivery of books and records to successor  office vacancy when  procedure for filing vacancy  documents of all city offices open to inspection by may and city council members  background check  voter registration required  residence in city required when any person elected to a city office must be a registered voter of the city any person appointed to any office enumerated in be a resident of the city hmc   employment of relatives prohibited when no person shall be employed by the city in violation of the provisions of title 52 utah as amended which prohibits the employment of by any person holding any position the compensation for which is paid by city funds hmc   appointment of city treasurer and city recorder on or before the first monday in february following a municipal election the mayor with the advice and consent of the city council shall appoint a qualified person to each of the offices of city recorder and city treasurer the city recorder shall be ex officio the city auditor and shall perform the duties of such office hmc   powers and duties  how defined the duties powers and privileges of all officers in any way connected with the city not defined by ordinance shall be defined from time to time by appropriate ordinance or resolution or direction of the city council hmc   oath of office all officers of the city of highland whether elected or appointed shall before they enter upon the duties of their respective offices take subscribe and file the constitutional oath of office no official act of any officer shall be invalid for the reason that he failed to take the oath of office hmc   execution of bonds every officer of the city of highland whether elected or appointed shall before entering upon the duties of his office execute a bond with good and sufficient sureties payable to the city in such penal sum as may by resolution of the city council be directed conditioned upon the faithful performance of the duties of his office and the payments of all money received by such officer according to the law and the ordinances of the city the treasurers bond shall be fixed at a sum not less than two thousand five hundred dollars or such larger amount as may be determined by the state money management council the bonds of councilmen shall be approved by the mayor the bonds of all other officers shall be approved by the city council the premium charged by a corporate surety for any official bond shall be paid by the city hmc   standards of conduct  conflict of interest policy this policy applies to publicly elected officers officials officials are to be independent impartial and fair in their judgment and actions as stewards of the common good officials are entrusted to protect the interests of the citizens of highland and should not allow private or personal interests to interfere with their official duties and responsibilities conflicts of interest all officers of the city shall adhere to the standards of conduct as set forth in the municipal officers and employees ethics act title 10 et seq of the utah as amended the act an official may not act or offer or agree to act in such a way as to help represent aid advise furnish information to or otherwise provide assistance to another person or entity exercising or contemplating exercising a claim against the city officials may not use their position to influence governmental decisions in which they have a financial interest or to secure an economic benefit for themselves or for another any conflict of interest must be disclosed as soon as the conflict is created or known communication officials will not disclose confidential information that is private protected or controlled unless legally authorized to do so an official is prohibited from using confidential information received or her office for private gain or for the gain of another members of the city council shall share substantive information that is relevant to a matter under consideration to other members of the council enforcement allegations against an official for violating this ordinance may be submitted in writing to an independent ethics commission commission as provided in 1031311 of the utah state commission shall prepare written findings and recommend appropriate action to the council hmc  history amended by on   terms of office  remove from office except as otherwise may be provided by law the term of office of the appointive officers in be until the election next following their appointment and until their respective successors are chosen and qualified except that they may be sooner removed by the mayor with the concurrence of a majority of the members of the city council or by the city council with the concurrence of the mayor hmc   expiration of term  delivery of books and records to successor every officer and employee of the city upon expiration of his term for any cause whatsoever shall within five days after notification and request deliver to his successor all books and records which may be the property of the city hmc   office vacancy when if any elected officer shall at any time during his term of office live outside the boundaries of the city for a continuous period of more than sixty days or establish residence outside the city during his or term of office the office shall become automatically vacant if any appointed officer listed in at any time during his term of office live outside the boundaries of the city for a continuous period of more than sixty days or establish residence outside the city during his or her term of office the office shall become automatically vacant hmc   procedure for filing vacancy whenever any vacancy occurs in the office of mayor or council member the city council shall by a majority vote appoint any registered voter in the city to fill the portion of the unexpired term of the office vacated provided by state law if for any reason the city council does not fill the vacancy within thirty days after the vacancy occurs the persons having the highest number of votes of the city council shall come before the city council and if there is not a majority vote by the city council the vacancy shall be filled by lot in the presence of the city council if a vacancy shall occur in the office of city recorder or city treasurer the mayor by and with the consent of the city council shall forthwith fill such vacancy by appointment for the unexpired term hmc   documents of all city offices open to inspection by may and city council members all records books papers and documents belonging to any office of the city shall be open at any time to inspection by the mayor or any member of the city council hmc   background check all current employees and volunteers or applicants for such positions with highland city may be background checked using criminal history records finger print checks name checks and warrant of arrest information in the fbi rap back system rap back system and win database as defined in utah state applicants may review the report upon request
